data.title: about
data.text:
kelly may

tommy savas

alex may

eric pumphrey

kelly may

writer / director / producer

los angeles & phoenix

​

Kelly May is a Writer/Director for film and tv, from Phoenix, Arizona. Kelly has created content, short films and series for Disney, Dreamworks, Sony Pictures Television, CBS Films, NBC Universal and Peacock. She was writer/director of an original sketch comedy series on Disney Channel. She was showrunner for a weekly series on E! She has written and directed commercial content for brands such as Adobe, Mattel, Airbnb and Pepsi. Over her career, Kelly has been able to hone her ability to bring abstract and emotional ideas to life. With 8 years in live sketch comedy, her strong understanding of comedy and timing is the undercurrent of her work and, she believes even the darkest moments in life can deliver a lesson in humor. Kelly is a member of the Producer's Guild of America.

tommy savas

writer / director / producer

los angeles

Tommy Savas is an American Cypriot Actor, Director, Writer and Producer born in Harlem, New York. Tommy has produced several award winning films, including “Evelyn X Evelyn” that was a finalist in the ABFF HBO competition and premiered on HBO as well as the cult favorite “Bad Roomies” which was acquired by Netflix. His latest project “Mother of Dawn” which he wrote and produced is premiering at SXSW 2023. As an actor, Tommy started his career in TV shows like “The Sopranos” and in films like “Rodger Dodger.” He has since gone on to work on countless other projects, most recently starring in the Disney+ series “National Treasure.” Tommy strives to tell original stories that showcase artistry, and above all, bring about change.

eric pumphrey

writer / director / producer

los angeles

Eric is an award winning Black filmmaker from Houston, TX. Utilizing over a decade’s worth of experience in acting and producing, his primary focus is writing and directing stories in live-action/animation that center Black and traditionally marginalized characters. Evelyn x Evelyn, his most notable film, was licensed by HBO. Shot on 16mm, it explores the grief of an African American couple through a macabre surreal lens in a mid-century setting. His most recent film, Luv U Cuz - an animated Sci Fi, premiered at OutFest and can be seen on Alaska Airlines and Here TV.

alex may

executive producer

phoenix

Alex is a producer and project manager in Phoenix, Arizona. With a career that started in repairing Blackhawk helicopters Alex found the importance of detail oriented project management. He went on to work for the digital data specialists Norivision where he managed the creative needs for companies like Blue Cross Blue Shield and Harkins Theaters. He's a master at creating community, problem solving and moving forward no matter what the hurdle. Alex started ditto productions with his sister Kelly May in 2020.
